32F080921-d-08-12-09-GRW.Narrative:
THE TRAIN CREW WAS SWITCHING OUT A STRING OF 28 CARS AT THE GARY HI-LINE WHEN THIS INCIDENT OCCURRED.  THE CREW SHOVED ONE LOADED COKE CAR (EJE 1004) EAST ONTO TRACK 8B, WHICH ALREADY HAD 12 LOADED COKE CARS OCCUPYING THE TRACK, FOR A TOTAL OF 13 CARS ON TRACK 8B.  THEY THEN BEGAN TO SHOVE THE OTHER15 CARS EAST ONTO ADJACENT TRACK 3B.  DURING THIS MOVE, THE CUT OF 13 COKE CARS FROM TRACK 8B BEGANTO ROLL WEST UNDER THEIR OWN MOMENTUM AND SIDE SWIPED BOTH LOCOMOTIVES IN THE CONSIST. THE LEAD CARIN THE STRING FROM TRACK 8B (EJE 1004) AND GRW ENGINES 303 AND 301 ALL SUSTAINED DAMAGE.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

THE 12 COKE CARS ON 8B WERE PART OF A COMPLETE RUN THAT WERE LEFT STANDING ON THETRACK BY THE SAME CREW EARLIER IN THE SHIFT.  THE CREW DID NOT SECURE HAND BRAKES ON ANY OF THE 13 CARS THAT WERE LEFT STANDING ON TRACK 8B.  THE CREW STATED THAT THERE WAS AIR IN THE BRAKE PISTONS WHEN THE CUT WAS LEFT STANDING BUT IT WAS LATER BLED OFF ON AS MANY AS 6 OF THE 12 CARS IN ORDER TO SHOVE CAR THE 13TH CAR (EJE 1004) INTO THE CLEAR ON TRACK 8B.

0808091-d-08-08-09-PHL.Narrative: 1800 BNSF CREW SHOVING WESTBOUND HANJIN TRACK 16 COUPLED TO CUT OF CARS.  THE ASSISTANT ENGINEER GOTA RIDE TO WHAT HE BELIEVED WAS THE REAR OF THE CUT OF CARS THEY HAD JUST COUPLED TO AND INSTRUCTEDTHE ENGINEER TO SHOVE. HE HOWEVER WAS NOT AT THE ACTUAL REAR OF THEIR TRAIN AND SO WAS NOT PROTECTING SHOVING MOVEMENT. THERE WAS A GAP BETWEEN THE CUT OF CARS THEY ACTUALLY COUPLED TO AND ANOTHER CUTOF 48 LOADED CARS ON THE TRACK. AFTER GIVING THE ENGINEER THE DIRECTION TO SHOVE, ASSISTANT ENGINEER REALIZED THERE WAS NO AIR AT THE REAR SINCE HE WAS UNABLE TO HEAR ANY NOISE FROM THE BRAKE SYSTEM.AN ASSISTANT ENGINEER FROM ANOTHER CREW UPON HEARING THE RADIO TRANSMISSION TOLD THE ENGINEER TO PLUG HIS TRAIN. IMPACT TOOK PLACE DIRECTLY AFTER.

THE ENGINES STOPPED APPROXIMATELY TWO CARS SHORT OF THE SLIDE AREA AND THE HEAD ENGINE BEGAN TO LEAN TO THE PORT SIDE.  ENGINEER SHUT OF THE LOCOMOTIVES AND FOLLOWED BRAKEMAN OFF THE STARBOARD SIDE OF THE ENGINE.  AS THEY WALK AWAYFROM THE LOCOMOTIVE AN ADDITIONAL AREA OF APPROXIMATELY 130' SLID DOWN THE HILL LEAVING THE LOCOMOTIVE NEARLY UPSIDE DOWN 50' BELOW THE TRACK. THE HEAD OUT RAILCAR BNSF 721997 UNCOUPLED FROM THE LOCOMOTIVES AND THE REMAINDER OF THE TRAIN RESTING ON THE FORMER BARRIER.  FINDING OF REENACTMENT:  ROUGHLY 150' DOWN THE HILL HAS A ROW OF TREES AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE THAT APPEARS TO HAVE GIVEN WAY POSSIBLY DUE TO EXTREME HEAT; THE AREA IS SANDY.

212618-d-08-06-09-SOO.Narrative: 198-05 TRAVELING IN AN EASTWARD DIRECTION, MADE CONTACT WITH A SEMI TRACTOR PULLING 2 EMPTY TRAILERSTHAT WAS TRAVELING IN A SOUTHWARD DIRECTION AT COUNTY ROAD 15, MP 536.07. CREW REPORTED THE VEHICLEPULLED UP TO THE CROSSING, SLOWED AND APPEARED THAT HE WAS GOING TO STOP, BUT THEN PULLED ON TO CROSSING. EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION INITIATED AND LOCOMOTIVE STRUCK THE SECOND TRAILER PUSHING IT DOWN THE TRACK. A DIESEL LEAK STARTED A SMALL FIRE ALONG THE TRACKS WHICH WAS EXTINGUISHED BY LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT. CREW MEMBERS OF 198 WERE REPORTED TO HAVE NO INJURIES. 212696-d-08-16-09-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to comply with failed equipment detector warning or with applicable train inspection rules.
212696-d-08-16-09-SOO.Contributing Accident Cause: Human Factor - motive power and equipment
212696-d-08-16-09-SOO.Accident Cause: Failure to comply with failed equipment detector warning or with applicable train inspection rules.
212696-d-08-16-09-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 295-15 DERAILED AND DRAGGED SOO 75688. CREW TOOK SIDING AT DUKE EAST, PROCEEDED WESTWARD TO DUKE WEST & STOPPED TO MEET AMTRAK 8.  AFTER MEET THEY PROCEEDED WESTWARD ON SIGNAL INDICATION; SIDINGTO MAIN TRACK.  FROM DUKE WEST SWITCH, THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 9667 & THE TRAINWENT INTO EMERGENCY & STOPPED.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND THE LAST CAR, SOO 75688 (EMPTY COVERED HOPPER) DERAILED & UPRIGHT, BUT BOTH TRUCKS AND ALL WHEELS WERE MISSING. INSPECTION REVEALEDPOD AT MP 373.13, 10:02:49 AT 21.7 MPH.  WHEEL SET #1 #2 (B-END WEST END OF CAR) DERAILED AT POD.  WHEN LAST CAR OF TRAIN, SOO 75688, PASSED OVER DUKE WEST SWITCH POINT, #1 & #2 WHEELS DAMAGED THE SWITCH MACHINE & THE WHEELS CAME OUT FROM UNDERNEATH THE CAR.  THE DERAILED CAR HAD TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 1460 & LOST WHEELS #3 & #4.  WITH NO WHEELS OR TRUCKS UNDERNEATH THE CAR IT TRAVELED APPROX. 857THEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY & STOPPED.  LATER, ALL OF THE WHEELS & TRUCK PARTS WERE FOUND.#1 & #2 WHEELS HAD MULTIPLE FLAT SPOTS WITH METAL ACCUMULATION ON THE WHEEL TREAD. 295-15 WAS GIVENROLL-BY INSPECTION AT MP 326 BY TRACK INSPECTOR WHO ADVISED TRAIN CREW THE LAST THREE CARS IN THEIRTRAIN HAD WHEEL SPARKS.  THE TRAIN WAS STOPPED, CONDUCTOR FOUND HANDBRAKES APPLIED ON THE LAST 3 CARS, RELEASED AND TOOK NO EXCEPTION TO WHEELS AND MOVEMENT CONTINUED.

OHCR1009DR-d-08-31-09-OHCR.Primary Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
OHCR1009DR-d-08-31-09-OHCR.Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
OHCR1009DR-d-08-31-09-OHCR.Narrative:
ON 8/31/09 AT APPROXIMATELY 22:21 TRAIN NEL2 TRAVELING WITH 3 LOCOMOTIVES, 52 LOADS AND 3 EMPTIES (8000 TONS) IN A SOUTHBOUND DIRECTION ON THE OHIO CENTRAL DERAILED AT FRESNO, OH. THERE WERE NO INJURIES HOWEVER THERE WAS CONSIDERABLE TRACK AND CAR DAMAGE.
UPON ARRIVAL TO THE SCENE, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE 9TH THROUGH THE 17TH CAR OF THE CONSIST FOR A TOTAL OF 9 CARS WITH 20 CONTAINERS OF MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTE DAMAGED.
CARS INVOLVED IN STANDING ORDER FROM HEAD END: GIMX639209, GIMX639459, GMIX639231, GIMX639534, GIMX639536, TLAX93044, TLAX92016, TLAX93084, NJRX23.
IT HAS BEEN DETERMINED THAT THE A END L1 WHEEL OF GIMX 639459 WAS THE FIRST WHEEL DERAILED TO THE OUTSIDE OF THE HIGH RAIL.THE SECOND WHEEL L2 OF THE SAME CAR DERAILED AT THE CROSSING APPROXIMATELY 400 FEET SOUTH OF THE POD. THE CONSIST TRAVELED FOR AN ADDITIONAL 1,000 FEET TO A SWITCH WHICH CAUSED THE GIMX639209 AND THEREMAINING TRAILING CARS TO DERAIL.
TRACK WAS LAST INSPECTED BY TRACK INSPECTOR LOUIS CRAIGO AUGUST24, 2009 WITH NO DEFECTS NOTED AT THE TIME.

ENGINEER HAD RUN THROUGH ONEOF THE SWITCHES HE WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE LINED AND WHILE MAKING REVERSE MOVEMENT, DERAILED DUE TO THERUN THROUGH SWITCH.

THREE EMPTY COAL HOPPERS WERE DEREAILED: UP 28165, UP 29285 AND CMO 288252.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT AN EXCESSIVE APPLICATION OF THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE AND NO AUTOMATIC BRAKE APPLICATION CAUSED WHEEL LIFT TO THE DERAILED CARS. THE SUBSEQUENT SHOVE MOVE CAUSEDBUCKING OF THE TRAIN DERAILING THE 3 CARS.  CAR MCHX 30558 WAS ALSO FOUND TO BE SHOVED OFF CENTER BUT NOT DERAILED.  OF THE THREE CARS THAT DERAILED, ONE IS LEANING AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE, THE OTHER TWOARE RESTING WITH ONE END OF THE  CAR ON THE TRACK AND THE OTHER END DOWN THE EMBANKMENT.  THE DERAILED CARS; UP 28165, UP 29285  CMO 288252 CAME TO REST INSIDE THE ENVIRONMENTAL ZONE.

0811091-d-08-11-09-MDS.Narrative: ON TUESDAY AUGUST 11, 2009 AT 12:00 PM., MERIDIAN SOUTHERN RAILWAY TRAIN # MDS2 SOUTH WAS INVOLVED IN A DERAILMENT AT MILE POST 103.4.  THE LOCATION OF THE DERAILMENT IS APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE SOUTH OF THE DESOTO COMMUNITY IN RURAL CLARKE COUNT, MISSISSIPPI.  NO INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED AS A RESULT OF THE DERAILMENT.  NO OTHER DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED TO ANY PROPERTY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF RAILROAD OWNED PROPERTY.  DAMAGE TO TRACK STRUCTURE INCLUDING ROADBED, CROSS TIES AND RAIL WAS APPROXIMATELY TWOHUNDRED FEET IN LENGTH.  THREE RAIL CARS DERAILED, TWO OF WHICH OVERTURNED, WHILE ONE RAIL CAR REMAINED UPRIGHT.  CONTENTS IN THE TWO RAIL CARS THAT OVERTURNED SPILLED ON THE RIGHT OF WAY FROM TOP ROOF HATCHES AS THE CARS OVERTURNED.  THERE WAS NO LOSS OF LADING AND OR CONTENTS FOR THE CAR WHICH REMAINED UPRIGHT.  THE AREA WHERE THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED IS LOCATED IN A RURAL CLARKE COUNTY, MISSISSIPPI AND IS SPARSELY POPULATED.  THE MERIDIAN SOUTHERN RAILWAY IS A CLASS 3 RAILROAD WHICH OPERATES IN AND THROUGH LAUDERDALE, CLARKE AND WAYNE COUNTIES MISSISSIPPI AND IS NORTH AND SOUTH, SINGLE TRACKRAILROAD.  WEATHER CONDITIONS ON THE DAY AND TIME OF THE DERAILMENT WERE CLOUDY AND THE TEMPERATUREWAS APPROXIMATELY 90'F.  FEDERAL RAILROAD ADMINISTRATION TRACK CLASS FOR THE LOCATION OF THIS DERAILMENT IS EXCEPTED-NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TO BE HANDLED.  RAIL AT THE SITE IS SIZE 901, AND IS APPROXIMATELY ONE HUNDRED YEARS IN AGE.  THE MERIDIAN SOUTHERN RAILWAY HAS OPERATED THE LINE SINCE YEAR 20
